reviews.text: I have just come back from a stay at the lux mar apartments for my hen weekend with the girls. i found the apartments ideal for us it was cheap for ibiza town area and had the essentials good air con, fridge and balcony. It was clean and maid service was good.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think you get what you pay for here if you want 5 star you should go elsewhere this was marked as a 2/3 star and i would say that was accurate.
reviews.title: Skip it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a noisy hotel we were out all night and was disturbed by other guests at all times of day/night but this is typical of manyhotels in ibiza and it attracts mainly clubbers. I would go and stay here again but with ear plugs next time!!
reviews.title: Good Basic Accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like quiet places, don't bother staying here. Its location wasn't the best as you had to walk over the hill to get into the town of Ibiza but there were lovely views from the street (you could see the Ibiza airport). We stayed only one night. It was odd that they handed you the remotes to the AC and TV (which didn't work in our case). They're not particularly helpful at the desk either. Surprisingly, the room we got had its own kitchenette (which we didn't use at all). The bathroom lighting is very poor (as was our room lighting). Luckily, we only stayed one night. I would not recommend it if you want something upscale.
reviews.title: Bring earplugs - and a moped.

likes.liked: — Well you are still in Ibiza.

reviews.title: Excellent location but very noisey
reviews.text: We stayed in the Luxmar for a week end June/beginning July. It is part of a much larger complex comprising two or three apartment blocks all grouped together.The (studio) apartment we were allocated was much larger than usual but with a side view balcony overlooking the run-down private apartment block next door and, through the solar panels on the Hotel Los Molinos opposite, a glimpse of the sea. There is a buffet restaurant and bar which we did not use and a small unsheltered swimming pool without any parasols that we could see. The Reception staff were uniformly friendly and helpful even though very busy with large parties of guests who seemed to be arriving day and night.The street and the rest of the buildings on it seem a bit run down and scruffy and there are a lot of empty properties which add to the vaguely derelict air. However, you are minutes from the Paseo Maritimo and the nearest beach is 150 yards away.The town of Ibiza is a 10 minute walk away over some pretty rough terrain, through a tunnel but iyt must be visited. There are still a large number of brilliant restaurants in Dalt Vila - fewer in the port area and the bars along the Calle de le Virgen are also good for a visit.There is a superb new restaurant on the Paseo Maritimo in Figueretas called Fusion which we would say is a must.All in all we felt that the Luxmar needs a bit of tlc but the location makes it worth considering for a cheap and cheerful break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first i was not impressed however we managed to upgrade to an Apartment with wonderful seaviews and a huge balcony. We must of been very lucky at our time of staying as we did not hear noise from any of the neighbours. It was clean and comfortable. So close to the Old town and for the price perfect. I would definetly return - Room 403
reviews.title: Pleasant

reviews.text: This hotel ( it seems more like a hostel) is extremely noisy. People are slamming doors all day, having parties in their room, moving furniture and as the walls are so thin I would have been able to tell what my neighbours were saying if I spoke better Spanish! Lots of things in the room didn't work although fairly trivial - a light, tv, hob ring. I found that because it is a large complex with people checking in and out constantly, the reception staff were not that friendly as they wanted to deal with your query quickly and move onto the next person. I heard one other English guest complain about the noise and the receptionist did not believe her. Believe me it is noisy! However the best thing about this place is the location as lots of other people have already said. Two minutes From Figueretas beach and a 10-15 minute walk to Ibiza town.
reviews.title: Take earplugs!

reviews.text: I would definitely not stay here again. I was out clubbing as much as most other people who stayed here but the thin walls and young guests 18-25 make it the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Not very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would only recommend this hotel to Italians aged between 18 - 30 because 99% of the people who stay here fit into that category. If you want something quite and relaxing dont stay here. The place seemed like a Giant Italian youth Hostel. They all seemed to be having a great time making their monkey noises all day and night, but after a couple of days you will wish you had stayed somewhere else, Italians are so bloody loud. The bathroom was a joke. Huge rust stains in the bottom of the bath tub, the sink was coming off the wall, the faucet was hanging off and the maid never cleaned the bathroom once the entire week. The TV never worked and was reported three times to reception but they never came to check it. There are some nice hotels across the street that seem much quieter and really nice, The Maritimo, Nautico Embeso and Los Molinos
reviews.title: Worst hotel I have EVER stayed in.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights on our month long holiday through Europe, and it was by far the worst place I have ever stayed in my life. Here's just a few of the things I remember:
reviews.title: Loved LUXMAR !

reviews.text: First of all I am a firm believer that you get what you pay for - especially when it comes to hotels. Nothing could be truer about the Hotel Apartamentos Lux-Mar.
reviews.title: Its sooooo noisy

reviews.text: I am going to start with the bad....
reviews.title: Excellent value for money, would recommend to anyone

reviews.text: 1. The word Hotel should be dropped from the name. Hotel implies some kind of service. The staff at the front are not very helpful. One of the staff tried to sell us a $EU2.50 map, when there were free ones on the display next to the desk he was on. There is no real service in the hotel, other than the fact your beds get made every morning.
reviews.title: Brilliant location, clean, friendly staff

reviews.text: 2. The water in the shower is full of chlorine. A shower will leave you smelling like a hospital - bleaching and disinfectants included.
reviews.title: Noisy, poor service, zero comfort

reviews.text: 3. The walls are so thin we could hear 'word for word' the tv shows from room next door. People coming back from the clubs at 4 or 5 am echo into the room from the staircase.
reviews.title: Noisy dump

likes.liked: — If you're in the seaside Panoramic building: the view
